annotation.spannedText: The MMR vaccination provides the only protection against measles

classMention.mentionClass: The MMR vaccination provides the only protection against measles

annotation.spannedText: Vaccination is the only way of preventing it

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination is the only way of preventing it

annotation.spannedText: Wherever you live in the UK, it's important that your children or teenagers are up to date with their MMR and other childhood vaccinations

classMention.mentionClass: Wherever you live in the UK, it's important that your children or teenagers are up to date with their MMR and other childhood vaccinations

annotation.spannedText: If your child has already had two doses of MMR vaccine, you don't need to worry

classMention.mentionClass: If your child has already had two doses of MMR vaccine, you don't need to worry

annotation.spannedText: Similarly, if your child had their first dose of MMR as a baby, but they are not yet old enough to have received their second dose, they are up to date and there is no need to have the second MMR dose earlier than scheduled

classMention.mentionClass: Similarly, if your child had their first dose of MMR as a baby, but they are not yet old enough to have received their second dose, they are up to date and there is no need to have the second MMR dose earlier than scheduled

annotation.spannedText: if your child is school-age and has only had one MMR dose, or has not been vaccinated at all, they should be vaccinated as soon as possible

classMention.mentionClass: if your child is school-age and has only had one MMR dose, or has not been vaccinated at all, they should be vaccinated as soon as possible

annotation.spannedText: If you have plans to travel to an area where there has been an outbreak of measles, make immediate arrangements with your GP for your children or teenagers to receive the MMR vaccination if they haven't had both doses before

classMention.mentionClass: If you have plans to travel to an area where there has been an outbreak of measles, make immediate arrangements with your GP for your children or teenagers to receive the MMR vaccination if they haven't had both doses before

annotation.spannedText: the best approach for children under 6 months is to try to avoid them having any contact with measles

classMention.mentionClass: the best approach for children under 6 months is to try to avoid them having any contact with measles

annotation.spannedText: It's also a good idea to make sure the rest of your family have had the MMR jab, especially if you are planning to visit an outbreak area, as the greatest risk is in the household

classMention.mentionClass: It's also a good idea to make sure the rest of your family have had the MMR jab, especially if you are planning to visit an outbreak area, as the greatest risk is in the household

annotation.spannedText: If your child has already had the vaccine, it should be recorded in their medical notes and in their personal health record (the Red Book

classMention.mentionClass: If your child has already had the vaccine, it should be recorded in their medical notes and in their personal health record (the Red Book

annotation.spannedText: If you or your GP are unsure whether your children or teenagers have been vaccinated against measles before, go ahead and arrange to have them vaccinated again

classMention.mentionClass: If you or your GP are unsure whether your children or teenagers have been vaccinated against measles before, go ahead and arrange to have them vaccinated again

annotation.spannedText: It won't hurt them to have the MMR vaccination a second or third time

classMention.mentionClass: It won't hurt them to have the MMR vaccination a second or third time

annotation.spannedText: If you aren't registered with a GP, find the nearest doctor's surgery, who will give your family the jabs

classMention.mentionClass: If you aren't registered with a GP, find the nearest doctor's surgery, who will give your family the jabs

annotation.spannedText: Simply call your local GP practice and make an appointment for an MMR jab

classMention.mentionClass: Simply call your local GP practice and make an appointment for an MMR jab

annotation.spannedText: It involves 2 doses, which can be given just a month apart to give protection as quickly as possible

classMention.mentionClass: It involves 2 doses, which can be given just a month apart to give protection as quickly as possible
